Dear Mr. Skorniat
You may recall that this past year the Fund for Adult Education
established an annual lectureship in this field. The first lectures were
given this fall by Lyman Bryson at Madison, Milwaukee and Wausau, Wisconsin.
The tapes that were made of these lectures have been rebroadcast a number of
times by the University of Wisconsin and Mr. Blakely has suggested that the
NAEB might wish to add the tapes to the stockpile they have available for the
NAEB tap© network.
I have talked to Bob Hudson about the matter. He has said that if
we will send the tapes to the Educational Television and Radio Center at Ann
Arbor, they will audit and edit them so that they will be in suitable shape
for use by the network. In their present form the tapes include rather lengthy
introductions which are probably geared too closely to the specific occasion
of each of the addresses. Moreover, they also include th© questions and answers
that formed a part of the public forum part of the program.
I shall appreciate hearing as to whether or not you would like to
have us send somewhat shortened and edited tapes of these speeches.
Very sincerely yours,
